page.title: 17Employment in Rural Areas
page.content: Finding work is always a problem in rural areas. Agriculture is the main industry and provides some employment; there are a few jobs with Bristol Waterworks in connection with the Reservoirs and the leisure activities of fishing and sailing. The 1 shop and 2 pubs do not offer much scope but a good many households do "Bed & Breakfast" for visitors. A new enterprise with hopeful prospects is the establishment of a light industrial and craft centre in Chew Stoke at the site of an old dairy. Private capital has been invested in 12 units converted from old farm buildings; electricity and car parking are provided. The workers provide their own tools and machinery and a variety of trades are already established. Self-employment is often the best chance of work in 1985.
